Title: Program Manager III - Quantitative Research Infrastructure
RoleDescription:
Riots mission is to put players at the center of everything we do. As we continue to evolve and deliver new experiences, the research discipline plays a critical role in informing decisions and connecting us to our players. 
Global Research Operations (GRO) exists to make that work more scalable, more secure, and more impactful. As a Program Manager III for Quantitative Research Operations, you will be the first dedicated owner of our quant infrastructure program  responsible for building foundational systems that support the entire research discipline. This is a strategic individual contributor (IC) role focused on infrastructure, governance, tooling, and data quality across quant research at Riot. Your work will involve defining best practices and standards, collaborating with craft and tech partners, and establishing long-term systems that enable consistent, reliable, scalable, and representative quant research. You will lay the groundwork for what this capability looks like at Riot and help shape how it grows. You will report to the Senior Manager of Global Research Operations.
Responsibilities:

Define and operationalize governance for Riots quantitative research systems, focusing on tooling, data quality, sampling standards, and scalable workflows
Partner cross-functionally with Researchers, Analysts, and Devs to design and implement scalable systems and integrations that support efficient quantitative research data flows
Identify gaps, bottlenecks, and inconsistencies in current quantitative research workflows, implementing sustainable process improvements that enhance consistency, data integrity, and operational efficiency
Collaborate with Research Craft leads to set and uphold standards for data quality and sampling (e.g., stratification, weighting, response integrity, oversampling mitigation)
Develop enablement systems (training, onboarding, documentation) to empower researchers across the org
Evaluate, recommend, and implement platforms, tools, vendors, and technical solutions to strengthen and scale Riots quantitative research capabilities

Required Qualifications: 

6+ years of experience in quantitative research operations or quantitative research program management with a focus on quantitative research infrastructure, tooling, or technical enablement
Experience working with quantitative research tools (e.g., UserTesting, UserInterviews) and survey platforms (e.g., Qualtrics, Sawtooth)
Strong understanding of research quality principles, including sampling, panel health, and data integrity
Experience designing governance for research tools, data access, or research quality standards
Experience leading cross-functional programs aligned to strategic priorities and craft roadmaps
Experience thriving as a self-starter in fast-paced, ambiguous environments with the ability to ramp up quickly

Desired Qualifications:

Previous experience in the games industry
Previous experience as a researcher (e.g., UX or market research)
Familiarity with Riots games and player base
Previous program experience in a large organization
Experience leading change management initiatives for large-scale programs
Experience with various project methodologies and their applications (e.g. Agile, Six Sigma)
Experience navigating complex, ambiguous problem spaces with overlapping or competing priorities
Deep knowledge of games, game audiences, and the game industry
Masters degree in a related field

For this role, you'll find success through craft expertise and collaboration that prioritizes your fellow Rioters, who are the customers of your work. Being a dedicated fan of games is not necessary for this position!

Title: Senior Software Engineer - Riot Client
RoleDescription:
The Riot Client is the gateway for our players to play, discover, and install Riot games. Every single player - millions at any given moment - goes through the Riot Client on their way to experience one of Riots games, and ensuring their needs, whether they be providing more ways to engage with Riots culture & community, or getting into their game as fast as possible, is the primary goal of the Riot Client team.  Introduced in 2021, the multi-game Riot Client is poised to become the destination for players to engage with Riot games, events and communities. 
As a Senior Software Engineer on the Riot Client team, you'll create the desktop software that millions of players worldwide use to authenticate, install, patch, discover and launch Riot's games. Your work will be players' first touchpoint with the wide range of experiences that Riot has to offer - including League of Legends, Wild Rift, Teamfight Tactics, VALORANT, Legends of Runeterra, and beyond. You will allow players to discover new games from the Riot ecosystem, unlock content, and promote overall deeper engagement. You will report to the Engineering Manager of the Riot Client team.

Mentor other engineers in your areas of expertise

3+ years of industry experience
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or a related field, or comparable experience in software development
Expertise with React, TypeScript, CSS, Node.js
Experience working with complex code bases
Have been responsible for driving the design and leading of development of efforts (over 3-month scope), including requirements gathering, planning, testing, and release or deployment
Strengths in collaboration and communication

Desired Qualifications:

Professional or other experience working with Electron
Professional or other experience working with C++ 
Understanding of build / deploy automation
